item.title: 特朗普风险提振美国收益率，美元飙升逼近 38 年来的日元峰值
item.description: 周二，在国债收益率飙升之后，美元兑日元汇率徘徊在近 38 年的高点附近，因为投资者在考虑唐纳德-特朗普可能第二次担任总统。【原文：The U.S. dollar hovered near an almost 38-year high to the yen on Tuesday following a surge in Treasury yields as investors contemplated the potential for a second Donald Trump presidency.】

item.title: 微软整合中国零售渠道
item.description: 据媒体报道，微软正在关闭其在中国大陆的授权实体零售商网络，对此，微软表示正在整合其在中国大陆的零售渠道。【原文：Microsoft is consolidating its retail channels in mainland China, the firm said in response to media reports that it is closing its network of authorised physical retailers in the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 石油维持在两个月高位附近，原因是需求前景看好，可能降息
item.description: 周二，油价变化不大，维持在上一交易日触及的两个月高点附近，原因是人们预期夏季旅游旺季将带来燃料需求的增长，而且美国可能降息，这将促进经济增长。【原文：Oil prices were little changed on Tuesday, holding near the two-month highs reached in the previous session, on expectations for rising fuel demand from the summer travel season and possible U.S. interest rate cuts that could boost economic growth.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行在维持利率不变时看到了就业的下行风险
item.description: 路透社悉尼7月2日电）澳大利亚央行在6月份的政策会议上考虑了是否需要进一步提高利率以抑制通胀，但决定维持现状，部分原因是劳动力市场存在急剧放缓的风险。【原文：SYDNEY, July 2 (Reuters) - Australia's central bank pondered whether a further rise in interest rates was needed to bring inflation to heel at its June policy meeting, but decided to stand pat in part due to the risk of a sharp slowdown in the labour market.】

item.title: 美国收益率提振美元，日元却萎靡不振
item.description: 美元受到美国收益率上升的支撑，周二中国的人民币和日本的日元等低收益货币受到打击，日元跌至1986年以来的最低点。【原文：The dollar was supported by rising U.S. yields and the blowtorch was on low-yielding currencies on Tuesday such as China's yuan and Japan's yen, which was pinned to its lowest since 1986.】

item.title: 工会官员称韩国三星电子工会将于 7 月 8 日至 10 日罢工
item.description: 一位工会官员周二表示，三星电子的一个工会将在 7 月 8 日至 10 日之间举行罢工，以加强针对这家韩国最强大企业集团的工业行动。【原文：A workers' union at Samsung Electronics will strike between July 8 and 10, an union official said on Tuesday, as it steps up industrial action against the country's most powerful conglomerate.】

item.title: 新西兰将继续实施媒体内容付费法
item.description: 新西兰保守派联合政府周二表示，将继续实施一项法案，强制要求数字技术平台向媒体公司支付新闻费用。【原文：New Zealand's conservative coalition government will proceed with a bill that would make it compulsory for digital technology platforms to pay media companies for news, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，Blackstone 将以 22 亿美元的价格向 MBK 出售日本补充剂制造商 Alinamin
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周二报道，私募股权投资公司 Blackstone 将以 3,500 亿日元（21.7 亿美元）的价格把日本制药商 Alinamin Pharmaceutical 出售给北亚收购基金 MBK Partners。【原文：Private equity firm Blackstone is to sell Japanese drugmaker Alinamin Pharmaceutical to North Asian buyout fund MBK Partners for 350 billion yen ($2.17 billion) the Nikkei newspaper reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: Salesforce 股东否决首席执行官和其他高管的薪酬计划
item.description: 根据周一提交的一份安全文件，Salesforce 大多数股东投票反对其首席执行官马克-贝尼奥夫（Marc Benioff）和其他高管的薪酬计划。【原文：A majority of Salesforce shareholders voted against a compensation plan for its CEO Marc Benioff and other top executives, according to a security filing on Monday.】

item.title: 供应压力缓解，韩国通胀率创 11 个月新低
item.description: 周二的官方数据显示，由于供应方压力减轻，韩国6月份的消费者通胀率降至11个月来的最低点，低于市场预期，令政策制定者稍感宽慰。【原文：South Korea's consumer inflation weakened to an 11-month low in June as supply-side pressures eased, official data showed on Tuesday, coming in below market expectations and providing some relief for policymakers.】

item.title: 零售商称英国商店价格通胀为 2021 年 10 月以来最弱
item.description: 据行业数据显示，上个月英国商店的物价上涨速度是近三年来最慢的，这凸显了通货膨胀的降温，尽管首相苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）在本周的全国大选中不太可能看到太多的好处。【原文：Prices in British shops rose at the slowest pace in almost three years last month, according to industry figures that underscore how inflation has cooled even if Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is unlikely to see much benefit in this week's national election.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局因交通管制人员配备问题放慢纽瓦克机场航班速度
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周一表示，由于一个控制中心的交通管制人员配备问题，进出纽瓦克机场的航班将放缓。【原文：Flights into and out of Newark airport, that serves many New Yorkers, will be slowed due to traffic controller staffing issues at a control center, the Federal Aviation Administration said on Monday.】

item.title: 制药商要求终止善达癌症诉讼的上诉遭法官驳回
item.description: 美国特拉华州的一名法官驳回了葛兰素史克公司和其他制药商提出的上诉请求，该判决允许 70,000 多起声称胃灼热药善达克（Zantac）致癌的诉讼继续进行。【原文：A Delaware judge rebuffed a request by GSK and other drugmakers to appeal a ruling allowing more than 70,000 lawsuits claiming that the heartburn drug Zantac caused cancer to go forward.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体在年度更新后加入罗素指数
item.description: 拥有社交媒体平台 Truth Social 的 Trump Media & Technology Group 周一表示，作为罗素指数年度重组的一部分，该公司已被纳入罗素指数。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group , which owns social media platform Truth Social, said on Monday it has been added to the Russell Indexes as part of their annual reconstitution.】

item.title: Affirm 卡用户的个人信息可能在 Evolve 银行网络攻击中泄露
item.description: 美国金融技术公司 Affirm Holdings 周一表示，该公司认为 Affirm 卡用户的个人信息在总部位于阿肯色州的 Evolve Bank and Trust 的网络安全事件中遭到泄露。【原文：U.S. financial technology firm Affirm Holdings said on Monday that it believes that the personal information of Affirm card users was compromised as part of Arkansas-based Evolve Bank and Trust's cybersecurity incident.】

item.title: 通用电气航空航天集团与首席执行官库尔普续约至 2027 年底
item.description: 通用电气航空航天集团（GE Aerospace）周一提交的一份监管文件显示，该公司已将首席执行官拉里-卡普（Larry Culp）的任期延长至 2027 年底，并有可能再延长一年。【原文：GE Aerospace said it has extended chief executive Larry Culp's tenure till the end of 2027, with a possibility of further extension by another year, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.】

item.title: Uber 在欧洲扩展游船服务，以满足游客需求
item.description: 优步技术公司（Uber Technologies）周一表示，它将在伊维萨岛提供游艇服务，并将在欧洲其他城市推出不同的水上交通服务，以满足欧洲大陆旅游业带来的强劲需求。【原文：Uber Technologies said on Monday it will bring a yacht service to Ibiza and will introduce different water-transport offerings to other European cities in an effort to address the robust demand stemming from tourism in the continent.】

item.title: 中国称美国针对人工智能的做法无助于健康发展
item.description: 中国驻联合国特使周一表示，美国针对中国在人工智能领域的某些投资无助于人工智能技术的 "健康发展"，并将在全球治理方面造成分裂。【原文：U.S. targeting of certain investments in artificial intelligence in China is not helpful to the "healthy development" of AI technology and will be divisive when it comes to global governance, China's U.N. envoy said on Monday.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售科技股的速度为 2016 年以来最快，银行数据显示
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）在一份说明中说，全球对冲基金在 6 月份以 2016 年以来最快的速度抛售了美国科技、媒体和电信（TMT）公司的股票，主要是受半导体类股的推动。【原文：Global hedge funds in June sold U.S. shares of technology, media and telecommunications (TMT) companies at the fastest pace since 2016, mainly driven by semiconductor stocks, Goldman Sachs said in note.】

item.title: 早间新闻美国收益率飙升，中国收获罕见惊喜
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 已倒闭的银门银行所有者因合规失误与监管机构达成和解
item.description: 已倒闭的加密货币贷款机构银门银行（Silvergate Bank）的所有者已同意支付 6300 万美元，以结束对合规失误的调查，这是 2023 年针对一系列银行倒闭事件中的实体和个人提起的第一起联邦执法行动。【原文：The owner of defunct crypto lender Silvergate Bank has agreed to pay $63 million to end probes over compliance lapses, the first federal enforcement action brought against entities and individuals in relation to a crop of bank failures in 2023.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Northern Data 考虑将人工智能部门在美国上市，最高价为 160 亿美元
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，总部位于德国的北方数据公司（Northern Data AG）正在探索为其人工智能云计算和数据中心部门在美国进行首次公开募股，估值高达 160 亿美元。【原文：Germany-based Northern Data AG is exploring a U.S. initial public offering for its artificial intelligence cloud computing and data center units at a valuation of as much as $16 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 世界银行集团启动 200 亿美元年度担保计划
item.description: 世界银行集团周一表示，它已开始运行一个新的一站式贷款和投资担保平台，希望该平台能将全球提供的担保和风险保险增加两倍，达到每年 200 亿美元。【原文：The World Bank Group said on Monday it had started operating a new one-stop-shop loan and investment guarantee platform which it hopes will triple the provision of guarantees and risk insurance provided around the world to $20 billion a year.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会起诉银之门证券欺诈
item.description: 周一的一份法院文件显示，美国证券交易委员会（SEC）已在联邦法院起诉以加密货币为重点的银行银门资本公司（Silvergate Capital Corp）证券欺诈。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has sued crypto-focused bank Silvergate Capital Corp in a federal court for securities fraud, a court filing showed on Monday.】

item.title: 解说员：波音认罪协议会如何影响飞机制造商
item.description: 熟悉此事的人士周日表示，美国司法部将对波音公司在两起致命空难中的欺诈行为提出刑事指控，并要求该飞机制造商认罪或接受审判。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department will criminally charge Boeing with fraud over two fatal crashes and ask the planemaker to plead guilty or face a trial, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday.】

item.title: 精神航空任命新首席财务官
item.description: 低成本航空公司精神航空（Spirit Airlines）周一表示，已任命弗雷德-克罗默（Fred Cromer）为新任首席财务官，自 7 月 8 日起生效。【原文：Low-cost carrier Spirit Airlines said on Monday it has appointed Fred Cromer as its new chief financial officer, effective July 8.】

item.title: 兴登堡收到印度市场监管机构的 "说明理由 "函
item.description: 兴登堡研究公司（Hindenburg Research）周一表示，该公司收到了市场监管机构印度证券交易委员会（SEBI）的一封 "说明理由 "信，因为去年这家美国做空机构发布了一份关于阿达尼企业的报告。【原文：Hindenburg Research said on Monday it received a "show cause" letter from market regulator Securities and Exchanges Board of India (SEBI) after the U.S. short-seller put out a report on Adani Enterprises last year.】

item.title: 波音-精神：飞机制造商如何瓜分陷入困境的供应商
item.description: 波音公司斥资 47 亿美元回购 Spirit AeroSystems 公司的交易，是飞机巨头和它们的一家主要供应商之间经过三方谈判达成的，是一项罕见的因危机而产生的三角交易。【原文：Hashed out in three-way talks between plane giants and one of their key suppliers, Boeing's $4.7 billion deal to buy back Spirit AeroSystems is a rare triangular deal born out of crisis.】

item.title: 消息人士称，空客上半年交付量增长 2
item.description: 业内消息人士周一称，空中客车公司 6 月份初步交付了约 67 架飞机，使今年上半年的飞机交付总量达到约 323 架，比去年同期增长 2%。【原文：Airbus delivered a preliminary total of around 67 airplanes in June, bringing the total for the first half of the year to around 323 aircraft, up 2% from the same period last year, industry sources said on Monday.】

item.title: 纽约杂货商 Gristedes 斥资数百万美元解决美国温室气体指控
item.description: 美国司法部周一表示，纽约连锁超市格里斯蒂德（Gristedes）将支付 40 万美元的民事罚款，并花费 1350 万美元进行维修和升级，以解决其商店冰箱排放的温室气体远高于竞争对手冰箱的指控。【原文：The New York supermarket chain Gristedes will pay a $400,000 civil fine and spend $13.5 million on repairs and upgrades to settle charges that its store refrigerators emitted far more greenhouse gases than rivals' refrigerators, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Monday.】
